channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for CA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for CA

item.title: Report E-2023070307
item.description:
Report E-2023070307

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-01T03:13:11+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-12
  • City: SACRAMENTO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal USA experienced a release from a box containing multiple 55-pound poly bags. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 75-pounds of product released impacting a 6' x 15' area of trailer floor due to the closure on the bags being loose. Contractors resecured the bags and tightened the closures. The bags were each then placed into their own poly liners to prevent further release. The released product was then collected and containerized into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.description:

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-29
  • City: SACRAMENTO

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE CAME FROM WRLT UNLOAD TRAILER 141131 WET AND ON ITS SIDE. INADEQUATE BLOCK AND BRACE. TOO MUCH WEIGHT ON PACKAGE. DescribePack: ONE BOTTLE LIGHTLY CRUSHED WITH LESS THAN 1/10TH OF A GALLON LOSS. OTHER HAZMAT PACKAGE SOILED. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: SPILL COLLECTED WITH PHNINE AND SMALL BROOM. PACKAGE PLACED IN HAZMAT BAG LINED DRUM.

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: When package was being unloaded from the trailer, it was wet so package was sent to QA for inspection by management. When inspected, one bottle inside package was found with loose cap causing leakage. DescribePack: Loose cap on plastic bottle was the cause of the leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed inside a plastic tote by management to contain the leakage.

item.description:

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-01T03:13:11+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-14
  • City: AZUSA
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: KAG West, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: The KAG West, LLC driver was delivering gasoline into the customer's storage tank. The driver inadvertently opened a valve on the trailer without making sure all of the necessary connections were made. This allowed approximately 10 gallons of gasoline to be released. The customer dispatched a clean-up crew to the site to handle the remediation.

item.title: Report X-2023070128
item.description:
Report X-2023070128

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-28T15:11:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-28
  • City: NEWARK
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was found to be leaking by a package handler on the load Side. He then informed management who then relayed the message to me. At this point the contents were taken to the hazmat cage and placed in a barrel. A DPR and ISF where then filled out. DescribePack: The failure of the package was that it had a loose cap. This created an internal leakage inside the package. The fiberboard help contain the leak, but there was noticable leakge outside the box. DurationRel: 5 and MitigateEffect: I isolated the package and placed into a Hazardous bucket. Then proceeded to take the package to the Hazmat cage. Once in the cage the contents were placed into a barrel.

item.title: Report X-2023070117
item.description:
Report X-2023070117

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-28T15:11:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-23
  • City: SANTA FE SPRINGS
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was refused (damaged) by customer at delivery. Package was then returned back to the station for inspection. It was placed in a red tote bin, for Quality assurance to verify. DescribePack: Upon inspection, package showed to possess cans of paint. One can was dented, causing closure to pop open, creating leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was contained in bag and placed in red tote bin for hazardous material and was immediately taken to QA for inspection.

item.title: Report X-2023061711
item.description:
Report X-2023061711

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-27T15:11:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-27
  • City: OCEANSIDE
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The exterior box was wet on the top, underside and side when it was found and removed from the sort stream. The excess liquid was sopped up using neutral absorbent materials . The rest was placed into a plastic lined container for inspection and processing. DescribePack: Both of the bottles had finger loose caps on them. They also had dents on the handles near the bend area. DurationRel: 6 and MitigateEffect: Excess liquid was soaked up by absorbent materials and the rest of the shipment was removed from the discovery site and sequestered inside a plastic lined container for processing.
